title: Cobham's £4bn takeover under threat from political turmoil and the timing of Brexit
text:
The offer by the American private equity firm Advent to buy Cobham has been referred to the Competition and Markets Authority

Political turmoil and the timing of Brexit could significantly delay or even derail Advent's £4billion takeover of FTSE 250 defence group Cobham.

Analysts at investment bank Berenberg said it would be 'naïve' to think that disruption around Brexit could not have an impact on the deal.

The offer by the American private equity firm to buy Cobham has been referred to the Competition and Markets Authority for an early-stage investigation into whether it poses a threat to national security.

It must present its report to Business Secretary Andrea Leadsom by October 29, two days before the UK's scheduled departure from the EU.

She has an unlimited period of time to decide what to do.

But as uncertainty around Brexit has mounted, there is also a possibility of Parliament being prorogued or dissolved in anticipation of an election in late October if Brexit is delayed.

Analysts said there is no reason why Leadsom would not be able to make a decision in these circumstances, but it is unrealistic to think it might not disrupt the process.
